However, I should double-check if any judge has exactly 10 years or not. In this case, none do; all either have less than 10 or more. So our initial count stands.

But without explicit information on whether each judge is currently holding their position, we can assume the data represents all appointed judges regardless of current status. Therefore, even if someone has 0 years left (like Federico), they were appointed and thus included in the count.

So, total appointed judges: 9

Anabelle Rodríguez: 6 - no
Edgardo Rivera García: 11 - yes
Erick Kolthoff Caraballo: 17 - yes
Federico Hernández Denton: 0 - no (but he was appointed, so count as a judge)

Wait, that's only 6 again. So 6 out of 9 have more than 10 years left.

So 6/9 is exactly two-thirds. Therefore, the claim is TRUE.

But wait, let me confirm the exact numbers:

Years until retirement >10:
